title: There's a new app that no self-respecting traveller should be without
text:
I am not generally one of those people whose thoughts drift back to supposedly halcyon days when life was better. There are few aspects of my own life that I’d want to see repeated in my children’s, certainly not my Seventies childhood, but the liberation of not being manacled to a smartphone remains appealing.

Yet even I have to admit that an area that has been truly revolutionised by the arrival of our personal pocket-sized portals to the universe; selfie stick-wielding obsessives and loud conductors of one-way phone conversations in public places notwithstanding, is that of travel. These days you can organise an entire gap year from your beanbag if you’ve got the time to spare.

In Edinburgh over the festival in August my desire for healthy food was happily sated when an online search pulled up the delightful Forage and Chatter, now a personal favourite… until of course, it slips my mind. One of my greatest acts of carelessness over a lifetime of travelling has been my failure to keep a proper record of my roaming and my many great discoveries, whether museums or cafés, shops or galleries, B&Bs or local hotspots.
